title: Getting Feminine Symbolism Right | with Rachel Fulton Brown
description:
Rachel Fulton Brown is an associate professor of Medieval History at the University of Chicago and the author of the recent book, Mary and the Art of Prayer. We discuss typology of the Holy Virgin Mary and how it shows us the cosmic patterns of masculine and feminine interaction in the way the world lays itself out to us. 

Links to Rachel's work:
Mary and the Art of Prayer: https://amzn.to/2SFvWKv
Rachel Fulton Brown Homepage http://home.uchicago.edu/~rfulton
Fencing Bear at Prayer Blog: http://fencingbearatprayer.blogspot.com
Three Kraters Symposium YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCum5ScIyxrlhTP6_luBGWBQ


My links:  
patreon: https://www.patreon.com/pageauvideos
paypal: https://www.paypal.me/JonathanPageau

website: http://www.thesymbolicworld.com
facebook: https://www.facebook.com/TheSymbolicWorld/
twitter: https://twitter.com/pageaujonathan

My website designers,  Anomalist Design: https://www.anomalistdesign.com/

The music at the opening is Russian Eastern Overture, by Rimsky Korsakov.
